attributes.action: UK TV news & newspaper companies should NOT be monopolies (say ≥ 33%) nor foreign owned (≥50%), ensuring effective regulation
attributes.additional_details: One of the main tenets of Constitutional Law is the ‘separation of powers’ whereby JUDICIARY, EXECUTIVE & LEGISLATURE are separate independent (checks & balances) bodies for governance of a democratic state; as ‘absolute power corrupts absolutely’. The media should not be regarded as the additional 4th separate independent body. Free press, NOT an uncountable, unregulated, bias press, is important in a democratic society. PCC action or inaction should be Judicially Reviewable. A media should not be allowed to support a political party but should be impartial (like BBC). Leaked information from ‘moles’, information covertly obtained, etc should only be used if certain public interest criteria are fulfilled, like exposing corruption, crimes, scams, incompetence, indiscretions, celebrity interests. Information obtained by breaking professional confidentiality, official secrets under the Official Secrets Act, harassment, etc should not be allowed.
